newsitem.title: USA: U.S July durables surprises, industry seen growing.
newsitem.headline: U.S July durables surprises, industry seen growing.

text.p: A surprising jump in July durable goods orders hints the manufacturing sector is growing gradually and suggests the economy may be hanging on to some of its second quarter strength, analysts said.
"This number fits into the story of the economy retaining momentum in the summer," said Russell Sheldon, senior economist at Mellon Bank.
Durable goods orders rose a surprising 1.6 percent in July against a revised 0.2 percent drop in June. In a Reuters poll, economists had predicted a 0.3 percent rise in July durables.
